body.head: A Breach of Promise Trial in New York
body.p: A case of seduction was tried at the Genesee Circuit, in this State, before Judge Dayton, which excited much interest— Jonathan Hutton vs. Benj. F. Green. It was clearly proved that the young woman, daughter of the plaintiff, was seduced and misled under a promise of marriage. The defence set up was most infamous — an attempt to prove the injured girl's character generally bad. The evidence in her favor was overwhelming — the more so, by the contrast with that brought against her. The result was a verdict of $900 for the complainant. Miss H. is a pretty young woman, with an expressively intellectual countenance. Her artless tale before the Court had a powerful effect in her favor; while the infamous ambiguity of her destroyer's had exactly the reverse.
